item.title: Remove Old Kernels in Ubuntu
item.description: To get started, open Terminal. When it opens, run the commands below to view your current running kernel. uname -r Next, take notes of your current kernel. DO NOT REMOVE THIS! Next, type the command below to view / list all installed kernels on your system. dpkg --list | grep linux-image Next, find all the kernels that which number are lower than your current kernel. When you know which kernel to remove, continue below to remove it.
